Posts.Content: Looks fab Denise! How long has it taken to get to that stage post chemo? Claire xx
Posts.Title: Took the plunge and went to hairdressers today ...

Posts.Content: Hi all not posted  for a while, have been browsing. Lost my mother in law last week so it's been a sad time although she was 90 and had a fab life to the end it was a shock and sudden!   Had my first T today... Ok so far, waiting for it to hit! even so feel good I'm 2/3 done!  Sirry sone of you are having a rotten time, hope things pick up for you.   xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Wow June already! Well done Amanda for kicking us off. Good luck to all starting this month. I'm due number 4 on 9 June, my first T... Nervous as not been too bad so far. Still at lest only 3 to go! Xxxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Ah thanks Chrissie. Yes we could have done without it just now and it's upsetting for the children to lose their grandma. X
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Morning all. T day 2 . Ok so far, steroid flush and was awake for 2 hours in night! Other than that ok, was up taking kids to school but now on sofa! Just checking re the getting ahead of the pain thing... Should I start taking brufen tomorrow just in case? I wasn't really advised . Thanks xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi Karin , my eyes bothering me too , barely any lashes which doesn't help but I think it's a symptom of chemo too. I'm ok at moment. Feel normal! Whilst T was worse than FEC for about day 3 to 5/6 recovery since then quicker I think. I'm struggling with the dressings on my PICC line tho. Have been fine but since Sunday I'm red and itchy and a bit sore on my underneath side of arm at edge of waterproof dressing. Odd as I've had same dressings before and it's not all over. Have rung District nurses and asked them to come and look but not heard anything yet.    Claire
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Thanks all. Very kind. I'm feeling tired but otherwise ok. Here's hoping T is not too awful as I think I got off quite lightly with FEC. ive been ok with PICC line too. Sounds horrid when it goes wrong. ((Hugs)) to those suffering and hope everyone sleeps well xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Sorry to hear that Janet, this happened to me too on third FEC but second blood test was ok so fingers crossed the extra day will have made a difference xxx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Second T done today! Only one more to go yeah! Feel ok so far but know will hit me Thursday. Going to take pain killers in advance this time in an effort to ward off aches and pains. I've put of my last treatment until 28 July which is 4 weeks instead of 3 as have a family wedding on 23rd and don't want to be feeling pants. They were quite happy with that. Feel like I can see light at end of tunnel now so that in itself makes it not so bad! Good luck to those having treatment this week.   Claire xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Ok thanks. I think I'll wait and see! X
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: It's hit me too! Day 4 First T. Aches started last night then overnight I was awake off and on, flu like symptoms. Aching all over rather than joint pain. I got up and did school run but do feel weird. Aching is less but have a fuzzy head, just feel off really but am able to function! Hope it passes as with the kids would struggle for more than a few days like this! This is worse I would say than my FEC experience but possibly it's because it's the first one and the unknown again as FEC 1 was the worst for me, maybe T 2 and 3 will be better?!! Wishful thinking but either way it's only two to go. Keep well all xx
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: Hi all. Well I had a pretty tough weekend after first T last Tuesday. Lots of aching and pains in my legs, Friday and Saturday. Started to feel a bit better yesterday and today better again apart from horrid taste in mouth and tiredness. I managed to keep doing things at a slower pace as with three kids there isn't much choice! I'm on sofa now as I seem to get really weary after not doing much. Hoping that each day will get better and I'll feel normal again soon before facing the next lot! At least I'll know what to expect next time. Hope everyone is doing ok or as ok as possible in the circumstances!  Claire x
Posts.Title: June Chemo Club

Posts.Content: That has really made me laugh! Honestly people don't think!
Posts.Title: stupid comments part 1!!!!!
